class_notes:
(Same as MESAS 337 1)
(What images do you have when you think of women in India? Saree clad, beauties? The aim of this seminar course is to examine and recover the history of women in India. Scholars have engaged for a while now in reconstructing lives and careers of distinguished women - leaders, artists, activists. We will read a variety of books on pre-modern and modern India to examine the history, lives and careers of India's women and examine how successful historical investigations have been, what their limitations are, and how we might open up new set of questions and approaches.)
course_description: India's women are presented in extreme images: spiritual or victimized. We shall consider the limitations of extreme and romanticized images, and open up new approaches in order to bring to life rich and diverse feminine figures.
